attributes.comment:
The adoption process is long and expensive. It is also risky. Many people pay thousands of
dollars and have failed adoptions. Adoptive parents are at the mercy of regulators from two
goverments. As an American Citizen if I have a child biologically I pay no fees for their
citizenship. If I adopt internationally I understand there are some fees involved. However, the
system as it is now is explotive. Often the adoption processs takes more that 18 months.Then
parents are forced to pay these fees twice. So if you raise them you should extend the validity
time to 36 months. Also how do fingerprints expire? Why can't the prints, once taken, be rerun
through every six months? Remember we have to have clean crimnal records to adopt in the
first place.
Please remember that the vast majority of us are people desperate to have familis and this is our
only way. Please do not add the US gov. to the many people out there ready to take advantage
of our situation.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anne L. Weston
